column5: Anyone been fishing at the Credit yet??
Might head out that way tomorrow, have a day off. Hopefully it wont be too crowded.
Tell me how it is aliright Marko??  Where u going eindale park or??
Yea thats the only place i`ve been on Credit. I`ll let you know how i make out if i decide to go
Alright.
as of friday the credit was chocolate milk and unfishable or I would have been there
Drove over the Credit at the 407.Water looked very clear. Yes I know thats along way from Erindale.
Should be somewhat cleared up by now, better be lol
Just got in and Erindale is still chocolate milk so looks like we need to wait a bit longer but that did not stop 4 other guys from fishing today.
Damn ima rookie fisherman jus started last summer and only went to the credit once cant wait to start fishing again
Why the crdit when most if not all other rivers are in some sort of fishable state?
FYI Credit flow is prime now
Correct. Not sure where some of the info has come from, but the river has been in prime shape for several days now.
There are so many conflicting reports one says prime the other mud????  Jose
It's prime and has been fishing very well since Sat. Getting lower and clearer each day.
I knew i should have gone there today but nooo it was muddy apparently. Should have known better and checked it out myself lol
Ha Marko shoulda coulda woulda didnt..  If anyone goes take some pics
I'll do that tomorrow
Alrighty A.G
Mike That's that I was thinking too. Since it is March break, stuck at home with the kids. Maybe Friday, if I am lucky  Jose
That was from 4pm looks good to me hope that helps
Looks pretty good thanks for the pic's A.G

Thought that pile of drift wood in the first pick was just cleared from the ice breakers..  The city outta do a better job of keeping those ice breakers clear..  Can someone explain to me what they're there for?  Seems to me that they're doing more harm than good.
